meanings.definition: A person who is intolerant towards those holding different opinions.
meanings.sent1: Some bigots refuse to listen to anyone with different ideas.
meanings.sent2: The bigots in the group always shut down any new suggestions.
meanings.sent3: The bigots at the meeting only wanted to hear their own thoughts.
meanings.sent4: Her father was a bigot when it came to discussing politics.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bigot with closed ears symbolized intolerance.

meanings.definition: A person who is prejudiced or biased, especially against a particular group.
meanings.sent1: The bigots in the town spread harmful rumors about the minority community.
meanings.sent2: She realized her uncle was a bigot when he made offensive comments.
meanings.sent3: The bigots at the party only talked to people who looked like them.
meanings.sent4: His boss was a bigot who discriminated against employees based on race.
meanings.sent5: The label of bigot stuck to him like a stubborn stain.
